summary: The bill, titled the Prioritizing Resources for Outreach, Safety, Violence Prevention, Youth Empowerment and Resilience Act of 2025 (PROSPER Act of 2025), authorizes the Attorney General to award grants for youth gun violence prevention programs. These programs must implement evidence-informed strategies that are culturally competent and trauma-informed, focusing on healing, youth empowerment, mental health connections, community engagement, resource development, and reintegration. Funding is allocated from juvenile justice program appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030, with specific definitions for eligible entities and key terms.
